main_text.sentence: As additional mechanisms of tissue retention the formation of intracellular conjugates was reported for budesonide and ciclesonide's active metabolite [20,21].

In a study with a novel ICS ciclesonide, its effects were studied in a parallel-group, double-blind, placebo-controlled, randomized cross-over study (washout period 3â€“8 weeks) in patients (n = 29) with mild to moderate asthma [43].

source_text.title: Reversible fatty acid conjugation of budesonide. Novel mechanism for prolonged retention of topically applied steroid in airway tissue
Formation of fatty acid conjugates of ciclesonide-active principle in the rat lung after 4-week inhalation of ciclesonide
A dose-dependent effect of the novel inhaled corticosteroid ciclesonide on airway responsiveness to adenosine-5'-monophosphate in asthmatic patients
